metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7322 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: usersfile.c in liboath in OATH Toolkit before 2.4.1 does not properly handle lines containing an invalid one-time-password (OTP) type and a user name in /etc/users.oath, which causes the wrong line to be updated when invalidating an OTP and allows context-dependent attackers to conduct replay attacks, as demonstrated by a commented out line when using libpam-oath.

criterions.comment: oath-toolkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
